smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function oneToMany is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function displayGrades appears to be too complex.
The function monthNameNominative appears to be too complex.
The function onCreate appears to be too complex.
The function bindViewHolder appears to be too complex.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function displayGrades is nested too deeply.
Function compareTo is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: File 'Utils.kt' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'
Class 'ApplicationModule' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'UserRepository' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface Lesson is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface MainComponent is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

instances.message: This method is overloaded too many times.

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionThrown
smells.description: Thrown exception is too generic. Prefer throwing project specific exceptions to handle error cases.

instances.message: RuntimeException is a too generic Exception. Prefer throwing specific exceptions that indicate a specific error case.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message:
MeEntity().apply {
            account.setLogin(login)
            account.setFirstName("Tomasz")
            account.setLastName("Problem")
            user.setFirstName("Tomek")
            user.setLastName("Problem")
            account.setGroupId(5)
        } cannot be safely cast to Me.

InstrumentationRegistry.getInstrumentation()
                .targetContext
                .applicationContext cannot be safely cast to MainApplication.
original cannot be safely cast to Identifiable.

RuntimeEnvironment.application
                .getSystemService(Context.CONNECTIVITY_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to ConnectivityManager.

MyNetworkSecurityPolicy::class.java
                    .classLoader.loadClass("android.security.NetworkSecurityPolicy")
                    .newInstance() cannot be safely cast to NetworkSecurityPolicy.
activity cannot be safely cast to Activity.
other cannot be safely cast to AttendanceItem.
other cannot be safely cast to AttendanceHeaderItem.
other cannot be safely cast to GradeItem.
activity cannot be safely cast to MainActivity.
other cannot be safely cast to GradeHeaderItem.
profile.tag cannot be safely cast to String.
activity cannot be safely cast to MainActivity.
other cannot be safely cast to AnnouncementItem.
findPreference("defaultFragment") cannot be safely cast to ListPreference.
activity cannot be safely cast to Activity.
other cannot be safely cast to HeaderItem.
other cannot be safely cast to EventItem.
activity cannot be safely cast to MainActivity.
other cannot be safely cast to LessonItem.
other cannot be safely cast to LessonHeaderItem.
other cannot be safely cast to EmptyLessonItem.
activity cannot be safely cast to MainActivity.
parsingContext.currentValue cannot be safely cast to TimetableEntry.
context.getSystemService(Context.NOTIFICATION_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to NotificationManager.
context.getSystemService(Context.CONNECTIVITY_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to ConnectivityManager.

smells.name: UnnecessaryAbstractClass
smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. An abstract class without a concrete member can be refactored to an interface. An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

instances.message: An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.
An abstract class without an abstract member can be refactored to a concrete class.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (Observable.fromIterable(res)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Observable.fromIterable(res)
Parentheses in (Single.just(0)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Single.just(0)
Parentheses in (Single.just(response)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Single.just(response)
Parentheses in (Single.just(response)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Single.just(response)
Parentheses in (Observable.empty<Persistable>()) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Observable.empty<Persistable>()
Parentheses in (Observable.just(grade1, grade2)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Observable.just(grade1, grade2)
Parentheses in (Single.just(readFile("/loginResponse.json"))) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Single.just(readFile("/loginResponse.json"))
Parentheses in (Single.error(HttpException.Authorization("url"))) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: Single.error(HttpException.Authorization("url"))
Parentheses in (return@onProfileChanged false) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: return@onProfileChanged false
Parentheses in (luckyNumber.date) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: luckyNumber.date
Parentheses in (exception.message?.contains("already logged in") == true) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: exception.message?.contains("already logged in") == true

instances.message: The class InMemoryEntityStore only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

smells.name: FunctionOnlyReturningConstant

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.
